New Records: Charith Asalanka is the Player of the Match
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka posted a 5 wicket win over the West Indies
The Windies made 185/4 in 38.3 overs in the rain-hit match
Sri Lanka made 234/5 in 31.5 overs to clinch the game on DLS method with 31 deliveries to spare
Kamindu Mendis hits the winning runs, a biggie over square leg for a biggie
Sri Lanka win by 5 wickets by DLS method
Post-Match Reflections: Charith Asalanka says it was a convincing win
Admits the plan was to attack and be positive with the bat
Tells it got easier to bat once the ball got wet and that helped them chase it down
Feels it is a positive headache to have when all the players perform but it is good for the team
Shai Hope says they can’t control the weather and the conditions but hopes to be better next time
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was nicely poised when Sherfane Rutherford and Roston Chase were batting
The ball got old though, the zip disappeared and then it was difficult for them to manage the run flow and take wickets
The rain killed their hoped and had to rely on the revised score as per DLS which didn’t help them
Others: The West Indies began brilliantly with the ball
Once the ball got old though, the zip disappeared and then it was difficult for them to manage the run flow and take wickets
Motie though was brilliant but he lacked support from the rest
